intro: Asplenium fuscopubescens, commonly known as the dark-hairy spleenwort, is a member of the Polypodiaceae family and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. It is a small, epiphytic or lithophytic fern that grows on rocks or tree trunks. The plant has a distinctive appearance with dark, hairy fronds that are often curled or folded. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. Asplenium fuscopubescens is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
